title: Teen shot in leg in Hill District
content:
A mid-day shooting in Pittsburgh's Hill District left a teenager in stable condition Thursday, police said.
Police responded shortly before 3 p.m. to Dinwiddie Street for a report that a man had been shot, Public Safety spokeswoman Sonya Toler said.
Officers arrived to find a 17-year-old had been driven to UPMC Mercy, where he was in stable condition with a gunshot wound to the leg, Toler said.
She said the teen declined to speak with detectives. The investigation is ongoing.
Megan Guza is a Tribune-Review staff writer. Reach her at mguza@tribweb.com.
